Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
March 23, 2021. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the
contract and MISEP requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your
contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 For repeat violations, why the prior CAP failed to achieve compliance.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Claudia Triestram, area manager, at (616) 552-3662.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan.
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and date
an updated treatment plan for each resident at least once
every 90-calendar days following the initial treatment plan.
One of six Updated Treatment Plans was not completed at least once every 90-
calendar days following the initial treatment plan. The report period was 09/11/2020
– 12/04/2020; report date 12/07/2020, three days late.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal Inspection dated 03/25/2020, CAP approval dated 04/08/2020.
R 400.4166 Discharge plan.
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care, all of
the following information shall be documented in the case
record within 14 days after discharge:
(a) The date of and reason for discharge, and the new
location of the child.
(b) A brief summary or other documentation of the services
provided while in residence, including medical and dental
services.
(c) An assessment of the resident’s needs that remain to be
met.
(d) Any services that will be provided by the facility after
discharge.
(e) A statement that the discharge plan recommendations,
including medical and dental follow up that is needed, have
been reviewed with the resident and with the parent and with
the responsible case manager.
(f) The name and official title of the person to whom the
resident was discharged.
One of two discharge plans was not documented in the case record within 14 days
after discharge. The discharge occurred 12/01/2020 and the paperwork was
completed 12/22/2020, seven days late.
1

2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
RFCAN Contract Contractor Responsibilities – Services to be Provided –
Oct 17: 2.10.r. – Wardrobe/Personal Posessions
Page 24
The Contractor shall assure that children have an adequate
wardrobe as defined by and documented on the Clothing
Inventory Checklist (DHHS-3377) while in placement and upon
leaving placement. When the child is absent or at the conclusion
of the placement, the Contractor shall have a process in place
to keep the child's wardrobe and possessions safe until claimed
by the child or DHHS. If the possessions are not claimed within
90 calendar days, the Contractor may dispose of the items at its
discretion.
One of three youth files did not have a completed DHHS-3377, Clothing Inventory
Checklists.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not in need of consultation.
2

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period for the 2020 Renewal Inspection. There
were two citations, one for a late initial treatment plan and one for a late updated
treatment plan, which is a repeat violation in this inspection.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on their regular license.
